[Effect] Dirge Of Doom.name: [Effect] Dirge Of Doom
[Effect] Dirge Of Doom.description: Creatures with this effect won't automatically reduce their @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} value below 1.

Aura: Bane.name: Aura: Bane
Aura: Bane.description:
A 'good enough' aura for @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane} (technically not an aura, but, meh...)

This effect has an aura of 5 feet, if you increase the size, you'll need to edit the rule manually.

Aura: Inspire Courage.name: Aura: Inspire Courage
Aura: Inspire Courage.description:
A 'good enough' aura for @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IAjvwqgiDr3qGYxY]{Inspire Courage} (technically not an aura, but, meh...)

Made it as a 1 round effect, with sustained. Reapply every round, use Symon's Lingering Heroics macro or shift-click effect to edit in the proper duration (if you have the Extempore Effects module, which you should...)

Aura: Protective Ward.name: Aura: Protective Ward
Aura: Protective Ward.description:
Granted by @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.lY9fOk1qBDDhBT8s]{Protective Ward}.

You emanate a shimmering aura of protective magic. You and any allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC. Each time you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{Sustain the Spell}, the emanation's radius increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 30 feet.

Reach 'aura'.name: Reach 'aura'
Reach 'aura'.description: Reach 'aura', adjust radius as suits your equipped weapon.

Workbench ABP.name: Workbench ABP
Workbench ABP.description:
My attempt at ABP using Rule Elements (hosted on a 'Feat'). Not quite complete, but, useful enough. (My players decided against ABP so I won't use it in the near term, but figured it might be useful for someone else, so I'm putting it in the Workbench.)

To use it, do not turn on ABP in Foundry, instead put this 'feat' in the Campaign Feats section on all characters you want to use these rules.)

Only lightly tested, but you probably need to remove and readd this feat after you level up.

Adjust the economy as much as you feel is needed. You don't need to remove runes from weapons and armor if you don't want to, these REs are implemented as Item Bonuses, so whichever of the rune and the character has the highest bonus is applied, except for Devastating Attacks which *does* stack with Striking Runes. (I used the Abadar icon as, well, I just discussed the campaign economy in the previous sentence, so, it felt appropriate. :)

Workbench Flat Check Notes V3.35.2.name: Workbench Flat Check Notes V3.35.2
Workbench Flat Check Notes V3.35.2.description:
This 'Action' holds several useful Note RE:s that when appropriate add notes about Flat Checks to rolls. To use it just add it to your characters/npcs and ignore it. It will automatically get upgraded to a newer version when it's updated in the Workbench.

It is far from complete, but it's a good start.

Currently handles:

  • Target is undetected, hidden, invisible or concealed.
  • Self is blinded or dazzled.
  • Self has Blind-Fight feat (partial handling of undetected)

You may get several notes, use the worst one.
